Eventually manages to hold steady enough to help Emily climb up and supports her despite shaky balance.
Raises the flaming waste basket carefully and passes it to Emily, showing cautious but effective action under pressure.
Encourages Emily to raise the basket higher despite their dire situation.
Rushes to Emily's side, lifts her in his arms, holds her close, and shows frantic concern for her wellbeing.
Commands Emily to raise the waste basket higher to trigger the sprinkler, showing situational awareness and leadership under pressure.
Maintains presence of mind to rejoice when the sprinklers activate, indicating hope and positive response to success.
Falls from the shelf as it collapses, losing physical stability and control.
Despite hypothermia and injury, quickly moves to rescue Emily and holds her close, showing care and urgency.
Shivers uncontrollably due to hypothermia, indicating physical vulnerability and limited capacity to act effectively.
Plea to Emily to hold on and expresses deep emotional pain at her death, cradling her body and shedding a tear.
Falls apart emotionally, showing vulnerability and sincere grief over the loss of Emily and others.
Despite his own injuries and disorientation, he crawls to Emily’s body and holds her close.
Shows no hostile or aggressive behavior toward the Man who watches passively, despite his anger and confusion.
Regains faculties after being injured and disoriented, assesses the situation around him.
Crashes car through vestibule door after being rammed by Security Car, causing destruction and chaos.
Rapidly comes undone emotionally, falls apart holding Emily, unable to maintain composure in crisis.
Looks at the Man with confusion and growing anger, indicating awareness and emotional response.
Tenderly brushes Emily’s hair from her face despite the chaos and his rage.
Creates and prepares a Molotov cocktail with intent to use violence.
Yanks a screwdriver out of Corey’s stomach, showing a moment of decisive action but no clear empathy.
Creates a Molotov cocktail using available materials and successfully lights it on the first try.
Removes a screwdriver from a dead body’s stomach despite emotional distress, showing physical and mental resolve.
Moves with purpose despite physical weakness and emotional turmoil, demonstrating determination and focus.
Throws a Molotov cocktail to burn the Man, showing savage elation.
Shows grave concern and fear after seeing the Man burned but unmoving, indicating some emotional depth.
Throws a Molotov cocktail with precision and confidence, showing decisiveness and aggression.
Fails to recognize the deception of the Man disguised as the Security Guard until after the attack, showing a critical lapse in judgment.
Quickly reacts with caution after realizing the deception, shielding his face from heat and investigating carefully.
Exhibits primal fear and terror when confronted by the Man blocking his escape, indicating a momentary loss of composure.
Falls to his knees in agony after being sprayed with pepper spray, screaming and writhing in pain.
Attempts to run to safety despite being in extreme pain and blinded by pepper spray.
Clutches a screwdriver as a weapon while incapacitated and in agony.
Fails to comply with police commands due to pain and blindness, leading to a dangerous standoff.
Calls out for help, insists the threat is still present despite being restrained.
Struggles and resists arrest despite being in pain and under control.
Drops the screwdriver when ordered despite pain and confusion.
Struggles and resists arrest despite being outnumbered and injured.
Fails to comply quickly and clearly with police commands, causing escalation.
Attempts to alert officers to the presence of the threat despite his compromised state.
Unable to effectively communicate or control the situation under extreme stress and injury.
Attacks and ultimately strangles Harold with wire, shoves Emily hard against the floor, and appears to stab Corey.
Lays next to Corey, covered in blood, then moves away revealing Corey’s injury.
Uses a wire from his tool kit to strangle Harold, showing resourcefulness and decisiveness in a violent confrontation.
Smashed the ATM security camera with a metal waste basket base, effectively disabling surveillance.
Engages in a violent struggle with Corey, resulting in Corey being fatally stabbed with a screwdriver found in his body, suggesting poor control or miscalculation.
Fails to explain how certain events occurred after disabling the camera, indicating gaps in planning or awareness.
Leaves incriminating evidence in his car (deposit envelope, watch, cell phone with 911 dialed), showing carelessness or lack of foresight.
Physically exhausted and emotionally bankrupt, shows no outward aggression or hostility while being taken away by police.
Takes money out of his account using the ATM despite the tense situation.
Physically exhausted and emotionally bankrupt, head falls to his chest, showing lack of energy or resolve.
Languidly looks out the car window and scans the crowd for the man in the parka, showing some situational awareness.
